results.title: Harry Roy in Floor Show
results.brief_description:
Harry Roy performs a love song “The girl on the poster” in a cabaret night club featuring a dance sequence influenced by Busby Berkeley routines.
No credits available.

results.title: Harry Butler's Tasmania
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian Film Corporation, Damien Parer and Don Anderson
results.brief_description: Harry Butler takes us on a journey through Tasmania’s unique parks and open areas, highlighting the love of getting away from it all.

results.title: Harry and the Lady Next Door
results.brief_description: The lady next door sings in a high voice that could shatter glass or hurt a dog’s ears. And, she rehearses constantly. Harry tries just about everything to drown out the lady’s singing, but even a mooing herd of cattle and a loud marching band cannot put a stop to the lady’s relentless rhapsodies. An action-packed sequel to “Harry The Dirty Dog.”

results.title: Harry's half crown
results.creator_credit: Ushaw Moor Secondary Modern School, Jim Moody and Derek Logan
results.brief_description: Filmed during the period, September 1961 to March 1962 over 20 afternoons. This is a film by the students of Form 3A at Ushaw Moor Secondary School, County Durham, whereby the work included film teaching, scripting, location shooting, acting, music teaching, sound recording and film and sound editing. Scripted after their own stories, this amusing film is about a lower middle-class adolescent boy given the chore of buying groceries for his mother but spends the time mucking about with his friends and terrorising the neighbours. During this little outing, he spots a half crown coin lying in the gutter, which he splurges with his friends on sweets - but where has the grocery money gone?

results.title: Harrison's Yukon
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Peter Jones and Shelah Reljic
results.brief_description: Ted Harrison settled in the Yukon in 1967. He has been living and painting there ever since. The Yukon proved to be a challenge Harrison had to come to terms with. The result is an artistic style characterized by bold, brilliant colors. Harrison’s perception of Canada’s North contradicts its traditionally bleak portrayal. His brightly colored houses and figures suggest a toyland dominated by mountains, snow and sky. The film is a fine introduction to the artist, his work and the geography that has so profoundly influenced him. (Award: Yorkton)

results.title: Harold Lloyd's world of comedy
results.creator_credit: Harold Lloyd Corporation and Harold Lloyd
results.brief_description: Presents a compilation of the best short Harold Lloyd sequences. Films excerpted include: ‘Safety last’, ‘Hot water’, ‘Why worry’, ‘Feet first’, ‘Girl shy’, ‘Movie crazy’, ‘Professor beware’.

results.title: Harold and the purple crayon (K)
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios, David Piel, Robert Sagalyn and Stanley Flink
results.brief_description: One evening, Harold decides to go for a walk in the moonlight, but there isn’t any moon, so he takes his purple crayon and draws one. As Harold draws his way out of adventure, children become fascinated by the wondrous magic of his purple crayon. Based on the book by Crockett Johnson. Narrated by Norman Rose. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Harold (A)
results.creator_credit: Flying Carpet Films, Marion Crooke, John Moore and Steve Thomas
results.brief_description: Harold Blair was considered a curiousity at the height of his career as a tenor in the 1940’s. As an Aboriginal, raised on a Reserve, Harold sang songs he had learned from watching Nelson Eddy films, or the classic operatic arias, although later in his career, the music of his own people formed part of his repertoire. Harold Blair’s life is revealed in this documentary through the people who shared his life and influenced his career; chiefly his wife and family. This is an intensly personal and frank look at an Aboriginal pioneer who had to struggle to achieve success and to reconcile his ‘stage persona’ with his Aboriginal identity.

results.title: Harold's fairy tale (K)
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios, Morton Schindel and Gene Deitch
results.brief_description: Harold draws an enchanted garden, only to discover that nothing can grow there because of the machinations of a giant witch. With the aid of his purple crayon, he defeats the witch and makes the garden bloom again. A delightful animated story for children. Based on the book by Crockett Johnson.
